---
title: "Response_curves_top5_combined_climatic-soil_data_models"
author: "Laura J. Giraldo Kalil"
date: '2023-02-14'
output: html_document
---

This script summarizes the response curves for the "top 5" models
for each Damburneya species according to the environmental variables employed to build ecological niche models with MaxEnt.

It is based on the models generated in all other scripts
using climatic and edaphic data to model the niches of 
Damburneya species (D. ambigens, D. colorata, D. gentlei, D. salicifolia).

Those scripts are:
Combined climatic and edaphic data models:    "Model_Damb_bioclimsoil_02mar23.Rmd"
Climatic-only data models:                    "Model_Damb_bio_27feb23.Rmd"
Edaphic-only data models:                     "Model_Damb_soils_01mar23.Rmd"

It calls previously saved model files and the top 5 models previously chosen, based on delta AICc organized in decreasing order. It creates a summarized plot layout by species, and models type.

First, call the required libraries
```{r}

library(spocc)
library(spThin)
library(dismo)
library(rgeos)
library(ENMeval)
library(wallace)
library(here)
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
library(terra)
library(ade4)
library(dplyr)
library(gridtext)
library(cowplot)
library(ggpubr)
library(scales)
library(rcolorutils)
library(tidyverse)

```



Now, call the models for all the species. 
```{r}
model_Da_biosoils <- readRDS(here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","ambigens","model_Da_biosoils.rds"))

model_Dc_biosoils <- readRDS(here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","colorata","model_Dc_new_biosoils.rds"))

model_Dg_biosoils <- readRDS(here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","gentlei","model_Dg_biosoils.rds"))

model_Ds_biosoils <- readRDS(here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","salicifolia","model_Ds_biosoils.rds"))


```



#D. ambigens


Generate response plots and data for the top models
MaxEnt response plots for D. ambigens are created for the chosen top 5 best models:
Da_top1   fc.LQ_rm.1.5
Da_top2   fc.LQ_rm.2
Da_top3   fc.LQ_rm.2.5
Da_top4   fc.LQ_rm.1
Da_top5   fc.LQ_rm.3


Da_top1   fc.LQ_rm.1.5
```{r}
# Generate response plots for 1sth model for D. ambigens

pdf(here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","ambigens","top_Da_BS","resp_Da_BS_top1.pdf"))
dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,col="#CC3311",main="Da_BS_top1_fc.LQ_rm.1.5", 
  expand=20,fun=function(x, y, ...) 
    predict(x,y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))
dev.off()


AWCh_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="AWCh",col="#CC3311",expand=20,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="AWCh", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
CECSOL_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="CECSOL",col="#CC3311",expand=100,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="CECSOL", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
CLYPPT_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="CLYPPT",col="#CC3311",expand=1000,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="CLYPPT", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
NITROGEN_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="NITROGEN",col="#CC3311",expand=50,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="NITROGEN", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
ORCDRC_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="ORCDRC",col="#CC3311",expand=100,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="ORCDRC", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
PHIHOX_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="PHIHOX",col="#CC3311",expand=100,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="PHIHOX", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")

Bio_1_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="Bio_1",col="#CC3311",expand=20,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="Bio1", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
Bio_4_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="Bio_4",col="#CC3311",expand=100,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="Bio4", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
Bio_12_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="Bio_12",col="#CC3311",expand=1000,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="Bio12", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")
Bio_14_resp_Da_top1 <- as.data.frame(dismo::response(
  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="Bio_14",col="#CC3311",expand=50,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="Bio14", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")

  model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5,var="Bio_15",col="#CC3311",expand=100,fun=function(x, y, ...) predict(x, y, args="doclamp=FALSE", ...))) %>% mutate(var="Bio15", species="D. ambigens", top="top1" , model="BS", key="Da_BS_top1")



```

Export useful information from the model: response data and lambda
```{r}

#join response data for variables of top1 model
top1_models_Da_BS <-rbind(AWCh_resp_Da_top1, CECSOL_resp_Da_top1,
                          CLYPPT_resp_Da_top1, NITROGEN_resp_Da_top1, 
                          ORCDRC_resp_Da_top1, PHIHOX_resp_Da_top1,
                          Bio_1_resp_Da_top1, Bio_4_resp_Da_top1,
                         Bio_12_resp_Da_top1, Bio_14_resp_Da_top1, 
                         Bio_15_resp_Da_top1) 

#factorize categorical columns
biosoils_cols <- c("var","species","top","model","key")
top1_models_Da_BS[biosoils_cols] <- lapply(top1_models_Da_BS[biosoils_cols], factor)

#export response data
write.csv(top1_models_Da_BS, here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","ambigens","top_Da_BS","resp_Da_BS_top1.csv"))

#export model lambda

lambda_top1_Da_BS <- as.data.frame(model_Da_biosoils@models$fc.LQ_rm.1.5@lambdas)

write.csv(lambda_top1_Da_BS, here("Modelos","biosoils_modelos","ambigens","top_Da_BS","lambda_Da_BS_top1.csv"))

```

```{r}
#Reorder variables to avoid alphabetic order display

#top_models_all_BS <- read.csv(here(
 # "Modelos","biosoils_modelos","resp_top_models_all_BS.csv"))

neworder <- c("AWCh","CECSOL","CLYPPT","NITROGEN","ORCDRC","PHIHOX",
              "Bio1","Bio4","Bio12","Bio14","Bio15")

datos <- arrange(transform(top_models_all_BS,
                           var=factor(var,levels=neworder)),var)



cols_tmp <- c("model","species","key",
             "top","tune.args")
datos[cols_tmp] <- lapply(datos[cols_tmp], factor)

# exclude data below or above the desired range in the layout
library(skimr)
skim(datos)

#exclude values lower than 0
datos <- datos[datos$V1 >= 0,]

datos$key_mod <- as.factor(paste0(datos$key," ",datos$tune.args))


#Create plots

#Crear una versión manual de viridis
vir_pal<- c("#fde725","#5ec962","#21918c","#3b528b","#440154")

#otra paleta blind friendly
#EVAL_palette <- c( '#4477AA', '#EE6677', '#228833', '#CCBB44', '#66CCEE', '#AA3377', '#BBBBBB')

#Edaphic variables

# AWCh
AWCh_plots<- 
  ggplot(filter(datos, var=="AWCh"), aes(x=V1, y=p, color=top)) +
    geom_line(linewidth = 1)+
    labs(colour = "top", x="AWCh")+
    theme_classic()+ 
  scale_color_manual(values=vir_pal)+
    coord_cartesian(ylim=c(0,1))+
    scale_y_continuous(labels = label_number(accuracy = 0.1),
                     breaks = c(0, 0.5, 1))+
    xlim(0,30)+
    facet_wrap(~ species, scales="free", ncol=1)+
    theme(legend.position = "none",
          legend.title=element_blank(),
          legend.text = element_text(face="italic", size=8),
          axis.text = element_text(size = 8),
          axis.title= element_text(size= 9),
          axis.title.y = element_blank(),
          strip.background = element_blank(),
          strip.text = element_blank(),
          plot.margin = unit(c(0,0,0,0), "cm"),
```
